page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: Considering that the communities within the block are rural the block is served by a reasonable transport service. History shows us that over the years transport in our area has deteriorated. Until quite recently the communities were served by a flourishing rail network. With stations at both Garnant and Brynamman. Today there is no rail service left within the block. In the past 12 months the bus services within the block have been drastically cut. Services to Ammanford and Swansea (the nearest large shopping centres) have been cut by half. Many old and infirm people are hindered from travelling to these towns by the need to change buses at a central meeting point, many buses traveling only as far as Pontardawe or Gwaun-Cae-Gurwen.
